result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob L Glynnell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All fines/court costs due by 03/05/16. Failure to make payments when due will result in 1 day in the Ozaukee Co Jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit to DNA sample at the Ozaukee Co Jail

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob L Glynnell

defendant.name: Glynnell, Jacob L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Dispatch, subject posted bond with UW Whitewater PD on commitment order
Debt has been certified to WI DOR tax intercept program.

Defendant Jacob L Glynnell in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 11:19 a.m. case recalled/same appearances. Defendant has decided to waive right to an attorney. Case passed for defendant to file waiver. 11:29 a.m. case recalled/same appearances. Defendant files waiver of right to attorney & plea questionnaire. Court examines defendant on plea questionnaire.  Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea & finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Jacob L Glynnell in court.  Jeffery Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case passed for defendant to speak with public defender. Case recalled/same appearances. Defendant Jacob L Glynnell in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 11:08 a.m. case recalled/ same appearances. Defendant does qualify for public defender representation. Counsel requets adjournment for time to speak with defendant.
Defendant Jacob L Glynnell in court.  Jeffery Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case passed for defendant to speak with public defender.
w/condititions: no contact with J.P or E.P

Defendant Jacob L Glynnell in court, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests cash bail to stand and no contact with J.P and E.P. Defendant advises court he will be in custody for next 30 days. Court passes case for defendant to fill out waiver of right to attorney. 9:15 a.m. case recalled; same appearances. Defendant files waiver of right to attorney. Court advises defendant of penalties. Defendant to contact public defenders office. Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.
